subtitle: did you know the legendary holy Buddha was married to a princess named yashodara and the Buddha and
her bore a son named rahula long ago in 563 BCE in the Kingdom of lumini Nepal sidarta Gama also
known as the Buddha was born in the famous gardens of lumini the destined soul of sidara Gautama made
his entrance under the Ethereal glow of the night Moon born to King sodana and Queen Maya
sidarthur's arrival was accompanied by Celestial prophecies for telling two possible Futures the
stories say that before his birth his mother the queen of a small Indian Kingdom had a dream
a beautiful white elephant offered the queen a Lotus Flower and then entered the side of her
body when sages were asked to interpret the dream they predicted the queen would give birth to a
son destined to become either a great ruler that will conquer 16 Empires or a holy man one day they
said he would either conquer the world or become an enlightened being the Buddha within 10 months
as a tree lowered a branch to support her a baby boy was born emerging from her side 7 Days Later
the queen died the world is filled with pain and sorrow the Buddha would one day teach in ancient
Buddhist texts in his formative years sidarthur's father apprehensive of the prophecy went to Great
Lengths to ensure his son's ignorance of suffering and the outside world by creating
an artificial Heavenly environment three lavish palaces were erected to cakon sidara in a life
of opulence shielding him from the Stark realities of existence outside the palace sidarthur indulged
in a life of pure pleasure every whim satisfied every desire fulfilled I wore the most costly
garments ate the finest Foods I was surrounded by beautiful women women during the rainy season
I stayed in my Palace where I was entertained by musicians and dancing girls I never even thought
of leaving Buddha said when he was 16 his father drawing him tighter into palace life married him
to his cousin princess yasodara it wasn't long before they fell in love he was totally in love
with her there is a story that on their honeymoon which was about 10 years long at one time they
rolled off the roof that they were making love on while in Union and they fell down but landed in a
bed of lotuses and lies and didn't notice they had fallen and so the stories say he indulged
himself for 29 years until the shimmering bubble of pleasure burst and eventually his son is born
named Prince rahula his father does everything he can to never let him leave never let him see the
suffering that life was despite the Royal efforts to maintain sidarthur's Blissful ignorance of a
luxurious ious life and Duty or rule one day an irrepressible curiosity gripped the Young Prince
determined to comprehend the nature of human suffering sidara embarked on explorative trips
Beyond The Palace walls on four separate occasions sidara encountered profound Revelations that would
alter the course of his Destiny one day disguised as a commoner sidarthur ventured into the bustling
Marketplace among the vibrant stalls and Lively activities he witnessed an elderly man struggling
with the weight of time wrinkles adorned his face and his once agile movements were now slow and
labored sidarthur accustomed to the Eternal Youth of the palace was struck by the inevitability of
Aging the sight stirred a deep contemplation within him about the transient nature of Life
on another clandestine Journey Sida wandered into the outskirts of the Kingdom there he encountered
a villain plagued by illness the moans of the sick filled the air and sidara saw the suffering etched
on their faces witnessing the fragility of the human body and the agony of disease he realized
that Health was fleeting and suffering was an intrinsic part of existence in a somber twist
of fate sidarthur's further travels led him to a funeral procession a lifeless body lay on a beer
surrounded by mourning loved ones sidur never having witnessed death before was confronted
with the Stark reality of mortality the profound Silence of death resonated in his soul prompting
him to ponder the impermanence of life and the inevitability of death's Embrace on his final
Journey Beyond The Palace sidara encountered a Wandering aesthetic in tattered robes the
athetic radiated a Serene Aura Untouched by the worldly attachments that had burdened s
ur's heart intrigued sidhartha approached the aesthetic and engaged in conversation
the aesthetic spoke of renunciation the path to Liberation and the pursuit of spiritual truth this
encounter planted the seed of a new possibility within sida's mind these four encounters became
the Catalyst for seda's internal Quest the juxtoposition of Youth and old age health and
illness life and death and worldly attachment and spiritual Detachment compelled sidara to question
the nature of existence fueled by an inner fire sidara embarked on a journey that would lead him
to profound insights ultimately transforming him into the enlightened being known as the
Buddha driven by the Quest for understanding Sida renounced his Royal privileges bidding farewell
to his wife and his son to the Comforts of the palace venturing Into the Wilderness he sought
wisdom from various Aesthetics and sages for six years sidara embraced a life of extreme asceticism
surviving on meager Roots fruits and raw food in pursuit of Enlightenment under the bodh tree in
bodgaya Seda entered into deep meditation as the sun set the light of Enlightenment bathed him and
sidara became the Buddha the awakened one the realization of the Four Noble Truths unfolded
the nature of suffering its origin cessation and the path to Liberation contrary to popular
depictions of Buddha being overweight he in fact was a very slim happy man the Buddha did not adopt
a life of indulgence after leaving his kingdom and gaining Enlightenment instead he embraced a life
of moderation regularly fasting and embarking on extensive Journeys to experience what people to
share his Newfound wisdom the Buddha's teachings encapsulated in the Dharma emphasized what is
known as the middle way a balanced approach to life also known as renunciation throughout his
travels the Buddha encountered various individuals each contributing to the rich tapestry of his
teachings an Infamous encounter was with angulimala a murderous Bandit who underwent
a radical transformation through the Buddha's compassion the Buddha encountered angul Mala a
notorious killer in a region where the latter was on a killing spree despite warnings from locals
about the danger the Buddha approached angulimala calmly using psychic power the Buddha eluded
angulimala who was intent on killing him amazed angulimala questioned the Buddha who explained
he had stopped violence unlike angulimala influenced by the Buddha's words angulimala
renounced violence sought ordination and joined the Buddhist Community despite his transformation
local villagers fearing angulimala sought King padi's intervention the Buddha foreseeing the
king's arrival asked how he'd treat angulimala if he were a monk the king initially skeptical
acknowledged he'd show respect the Buddha revealed angulimala now a monk and the King pledged support
this story raises ethical questions on violence it contrasts angul lia's compassion during a
childbirth crisis with the locals aggression towards him while modern law seeks to minimize
unnecessary suffering the Buddhist narrative suggests a form of restorative justice emphasizing
transformation over retribution the Buddha's Family Once distanced due to his renunciation
later converged with his monastic Community rahula his son became the youngest Monk while his cousin
Ananda joined the monastic fold these familial ties added a p Dimension to the Buddha's life
and journey as the Buddha traversed the Indian subcontinent his teachings evolved into two main
branches theravada and Mahayana in the year 483 bcee at the age of 80 with his final breath the
Buddha urged his followers to strive for their own salvation emphasiz izing the impermanence
of the world Buddha was then cremated and his ashes were spread among his followers the legacy
of sidara Gautama the prince turn Sage persists as a Timeless Beacon offering a profound path to
Awakening for those who embark on the Journey of self-discovery and Enlightenment many of Buddha's
followers contributed to Ritual practices now known today as Buddhism however they do not
worship Buddha like many religions worship God they look to Buddha as an ideal spiritual teacher
and follow his path of teachings that allude to the universal laws of Christ Consciousness
and the universe itself if you like this episode please like And subscribe to our channel for more
